summary: This is an email chain from July 2019 between law enforcement personnel discussing efforts to interview former employees of Jeffrey Epstein who worked at his New York home during the period of alleged abuse. The emails include attachments of subpoenas and background checks (Accurint/DMV) for one identified former employee, and mention a second employee who is yet to be located.

persons.name: Natividad Ruperez
persons.context: Named in a subpoena attachment; a prior employee who worked at Epstein's New York home during the time period the abuse was occurring.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the employer; the abuse of girls is alleged to have occurred inside his New York home.

connections.description: Ruperez was a prior employee who worked for Epstein at his New York home during the period of alleged abuse.

events.title: Subpoena issuance for former employee
events.description: Subpoenas were issued for a former Epstein employee, Natividad Ruperez, as part of the investigation into abuse at Epstein's New York home.

events.title: Employee relocation to Nassau County
events.description: Background checks indicate the former employee (likely Ruperez) has been living in Nassau County since 2000.

keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively pursuing interviews with former employees of Jeffrey Epstein in July 2019 as part of the investigation into abuse at his New York home.

One identified former employee, Natividad Ruperez, was approximately 80 years old at the time and was believed to have worked at Epstein's New York address prior to Epstein living there, when it was owned by Wexner.
Investigators had obtained subpoenas and conducted background checks (Accurint and DMV) to locate Ruperez, finding he had been living in Nassau County since 2000.
A second former New York employee was also sought, but investigators lacked a date of birth or good address for him at the time of the email.
The planned interview questions focused on the employee's knowledge of Epstein, the massage room, and the comings and goings of girls at the residence.
